title: Freckles

ingredients.content: 300 g dairy free white chocolate, broken into pieces

preparations.content: Line a large baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with paper cupcake liners of various sizes (approx. 30-40) (see Tips). Set aside.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and melt <b>3 min/90°C/speed 3<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and melt <b>4 min/90°C/speed 3<b>.

Transfer ½ teaspoon or 1 teaspoon of melted chocolate into each liner (½ teaspoon for mini cupcake liners, 1 teaspoon for standard size liners). Use a straw or skewer to spread chocolate in a circular motion to the edges to cover base of liner (see Tips).

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh sprinkles into it. Working quickly, scatter 1-2 teaspoons of sprinkles over chocolate (1 teaspoon for mini cupcake liners, 2 teaspoons for standard ones) so chocolate is completely covered. Allow chocolate to set slightly (approx. 1 minute), then quickly tip excess sprinkles back into bowl.
Transfer into freezer for a minimum of 30 minutes to set. Unwrap freckles and store in a freezable container until ready to use.

hintsAndTricks: This recipe will make 30-40 freckles depending on the size of the cupcake liners or moulds used.
To make larger freckles, use Texas muffin liners or large silicone muffin moulds.
If the chocolate hardens, mix <strong data-mce-contenteditable="false">3 min/50°C/speed 2<b>, or until chocolate melts again.
You can use a combination of milk, white and dark chocolate.
You can make the freckles as far in advance as you like. Store them in a container in the freezer until ready to use.
